%text Just like $(a+b)^n$ \underline\text{except} that $b$ is replaced with $-b$. Which means, \[ (a-b)^n = (a+(-b))^n \]
And hence, for a \underline\text{positive integer} $n$
% \begin{align} (a-b)^n &= {^n}C_0 a^n + {^n}C_1a^{n-1}(-b)^1 + \\ & {^n}C_2 a^{n-1}(-b)^2 + \ldots + {^n}C_na^0(-b)^n \\ &= \sum_{k=1}^n {^n}C_k\cdot a^{n-k}\cdot (-1)^kb^k \end{align}
%text
\underline\text{Notice the $(-1)^k$ term in the expansion}. Most people forget about this term. %
